Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the CCTV footage is of the Pulwama terror attack when it is actually footage from Iraq and Syria.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on videos that have been shared on social media without proper verification.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the CCTV footage is authentic and related to the Pulwama terror attack without proper evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the CCTV footage is from Iraq and Syria, not from the Pulwama attack.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the CCTV footage by presenting it as evidence of the Pulwama terror attack when it is not.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating biases in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by relying on social media videos without proper verification and not considering alternative explanations.
